explanation: The code used N/2+1 to compute the majority threshold. In Python 3 the / operator produces a float, so comparisons like A >= (N/2+1) behave incorrectly for odd N (e.g. N=3 gives threshold 2.5, so A must reach 3 to satisfy it, even though the correct majority is 2). I fixed this by using integer division (//) so the threshold is computed as N//2 + 1 (an integer).
